document.docAuthor: KITS, JOEL H. & MARSHALL, STEPHEN A.
document.docTitle: Poecilantrops stellans KITS & MARSHALL 2013, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Generic classification of the Archiborborinae (Diptera: Sphaeroceridae), with a revision of Antrops Enderlein, Coloantrops gen. nov., Maculantrops gen. nov., Photoantrops gen. nov., and Poecilantrops gen. nov.

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Generic classification of the Archiborborinae (Diptera: Sphaeroceridae), with a revision of Antrops Enderlein, Coloantrops gen. nov., Maculantrops gen. nov., Photoantrops gen. nov., and Poecilantrops gen. nov.

subSubSection.paragraph: Description. Head black, clypeus, maxillary palp, and prementum dark brown. Antenna reddish brown. Occiput, frontal plate behind ocelli, orbital plates, ventral part of gena, face immediately below antenna, and ventral half of prementum with microtomentum. Ocellar bristles just anterior to median ocellus. Anterior genal and subvibrissal bristle about 0.3X length of vibrissa.

Thorax black, mostly shiny; lateral and posterior margins of scutum, lateral corners of scutellum, small dorsal posterior patch on anepisternum, ventral margin of katepisternum, dorsal half of anepimeron, stripe between posterior spiracle and hind coxa, and laterotergites covered with microtomentum. Halter whitish, brown below knob. Acrostichal bristtles in 6 irregular rows, proepisternum with 2 setae.

Legs black, femora orange at base, trochanters orange, tarsi dark brown. Mid tibia with anterodorsal and posterodorsal rows, 1 anteroventral, 1 posteroventral, ring of 4 subapical bristles. Hind tibia with 2 ventroapicals, slightly longer than width of tibia.
Wing with membrane brown, veins dark brown, white spots on crossveins r-m and dm-cu, 2 circular spots on vein R distal to r-m and 2 on CuA 1 .

Abdomen with tergites black, heavily sclerotized, covered with microtomentum. Syntergite 1+2 with a median ridge. Sternites of male strongly sclerotized, black, covered with microtomentum, sternites of female weakly sclerotized.

Female postabdomen: Tergites 6–7 weakly sclerotized, wider than long but with 3 weakly sclerotized strips posterior to the row of setae. Tergite 8 heavily sclerotized, trapezoidal, covered with microtomentum except anteromedial patch. Epiproct with microtomentum medially, 2 setae. Cerci covered with microtomentum. Sternites 6–7 weakly sclerotized, roughly as long as wide, with weakly sclerotized anterior strips. Sclerites of sternite 8 much longer than wide, heavily sclerotized, with microtomentum and setae apically. Hypoproct moderately sclerotized, lozenge shaped, covered with microtomentum. Spermathecae sausage-shaped, annulated.

Comments. The species name (Latin
stellans
, starry) is a reference to the bold white spots on the wings, contrasting with the otherwise dark wings and body of this species. This is the only species of
Poecilantrops
with a shiny scutum.
